description.para: This spell is used to create a bond of affinity between the caster and an object or enchantment. Attunement is the first step towards controlling an enchantment or object, and is not actually an end in itself. It will only work on enchantments of equal or lower rank.

Minor artifacts which have a mental trigger action must be attuned to before they can be used. Other minor artifacts do no require attuning (and hence can be used by non-Shek-Pvar). Major artifacts require attuning in order to control the artifact, though it may choose to use its powers without attunement.

When an item is attuned to, the Shek-Pvar will know all powers in the artifact up to the rank of the Attune, as well as knowing the number and convocation of the others, and whether they are within two ranks of the Attune, or higher.

Regardless of the rank of the Attune, the trigger words or actions for a minor artifact will be known. However, for mental triggers, the Attune must equal the rank of the spells. Since spells can only be cast in order, a single high rank spell in an artifact can block the casting of all the other spells.

This spell prepares an item for enchantment as a minor artifact. The item should be a suitable foci of the given convocation, and this spell enhances link the item has with its convocation. The number of spells which can be stored in the minor artifact is given by the suitability of the item (see table below), multiplied by the rank of the Focus.
See the section on making minor artifacts for details on what materials and objects are considered suitable.

This spell summons a Pvaric elemental out of some mundane quantity of that element. Neutral and Savoryan elementals can be summoned anywhere. The size of the elemental varies according to the rank of the spell.

The elemental must remain within the range of the spell at all times. If the Shek-Pvar forces the elemental out of range, or circumstances allow this to occur, then she looses control of the elemental. Regardless of the spell range, the elemental will initially appear within Near of the caster.
The caster must make an oppossed will roll to control the elemental when it is first summoned. The elemental can be communicated with using a suitable Pvaric language.
Prevents elementals of the same convocation from entering the area protected. Elementals of equal to or lower rank than the rank of this spell are affected.

spell.name: Speak with Elemental
spell.boost: +20 All designated targets within range can speak with elementals.
+40 Targets can speak with all elementals, regardless of the elemental's convocation.

description.para: Enables the target to speak the language of elementals of the spell's convocation.

This spell blocks spell of the same convocation from affecting the caster assuming that they are of equal or lower rank. The caster is also prevented from casting such spells himself, regardless of the target of such spells.
When invoked against a particular Elemental, this spell causes pain and disruption in the target, destroying part of it. One wound level of damage is caused per rank of the spell.
